summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a Bureau of Prisons Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on August 4, 2021. The interview is part of the OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances. The witness discusses her role, the transfer of Epstein's cellmate Efrain Reyes, and her lack of direct knowledge about events leading to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) whose death is under investigation. He was housed in the SHU with a cellmate named Efrain Reyes.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the SHU. He was transferred from the MCC on August 9, 2019, which is a point of focus in the investigation.

persons.name: I.M. Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate mentioned in the daily lieutenant log as being placed on 'dry cell' in R&D on August 9, 2019. The witness has no knowledge of this event.

persons.name: Javon Bussey
persons.context: Inmate listed alongside Efrain Reyes in a U.S. Marshals Service transfer email for August 9, 2019.

persons.name: M. Arafat
persons.context: Custody staff member who submitted a count slip from R&D at 10 p.m. on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Dupree
persons.context: Custody staff member (likely) listed on a count slip from R&D at 12:01 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Joyner
persons.context: Custody staff member (likely) listed on a count slip from R&D at 12:01 a.m. on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Noel
persons.context: Officer who was in the SHU at the time of Epstein's death. The witness was asked to conduct wellness check calls to this officer and another in August 2019 but never made contact.

persons.name: Elzahr
persons.context: Person from the U.S. Marshals Service who sent an email regarding prisoner transfers on August 8, 2019.

connections.description: Efrain Reyes was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate in the SHU at the MCC. Reyes was transferred out on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.
Both inmates were listed together in a U.S. Marshals Service email for transfer from MCC to a GEO facility on August 9, 2019.

events.title: Transfer of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes, Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate, is transferred from the MCC to a GEO facility. U.S. Marshals Service emails indicate the transfer was scheduled for this date. The witness states a transfer with 'WAB' (With All Belongings) means the inmate is not coming back.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez placed on dry cell
events.description: The daily lieutenant log indicates inmate I.M. Fernandez was placed on 'dry cell with staff watching' in R&D at 3:15 p.m. The witness has no knowledge of this event and states it is not standard procedure for R&D.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein's death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC. The witness was called in to work that day and heard he had committed suicide.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Supervisor
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP Supervisory Correctional Systems Specialist at the MCC as part of its investigation into Epstein's death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
GEO facility (contract facility for federal inmates)
keyFacts: The witness, a BOP supervisor in Receiving and Discharge (R&D), had no direct interaction with Jeffrey Epstein during his stay at the MCC.

Emails from the U.S. Marshals Service show Efrain Reyes was scheduled for transfer (WAB - With All Belongings) on August 9, 2019, not for court as some staff believed. The witness states WAB definitively means an inmate is not returning.

The witness states the internal court list/roster generated for the SHU is printed daily and discarded, not retained, making it impossible to verify what was listed next to Reyes's name (e.g., WAB) after the fact.

The witness heard rumors about staff not conducting rounds/counts and falsifying logs on August 9-10, 2019, but has no firsthand knowledge. She attributes potential problems to a lack of training and staffing.
The witness was asked to conduct wellness check calls to Officers Noel and another officer in August 2019 but never made contact with them.
